headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Good day, everyone. Welcome to VeriSign's Second Quarter 2018 Earnings Call. Today's conference is being recorded, and unauthorized recording of this call is not permitted.At this time, I'd like to turn the conference over to Mr. David Ashley, Vice Pres
componenttext:
Good day, everyone. Welcome to VeriSign's Second Quarter 2018 Earnings Call. Today's conference is being recorded, and unauthorized recording of this call is not permitted.
At this time, I'd like to turn the conference over to Mr. David Ashley, Vice President of Investor Relations and Corporate Treasurer. Please go ahead, sir.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thank you, operator, and good afternoon, everyone. Welcome to VeriSign's Second Quarter 2018 Earnings Call. With me are Jim Bidzos, Executive Chairman, President and CEO; Todd Strubbe, Executive Vice President and COO; and George Kilguss, Executive Vice P
componenttext:
Thank you, operator, and good afternoon, everyone. Welcome to VeriSign's Second Quarter 2018 Earnings Call. With me are Jim Bidzos, Executive Chairman, President and CEO; Todd Strubbe, Executive Vice President and COO; and George Kilguss, Executive Vice President and CFO.
This call and our presentation are being webcast from our Investor Relations website, which is available under About VeriSign on verisign.com. There, you will also find our second quarter 2018 earnings release. At the end of this call, the presentation will be available on that site, and within a few hours, the replay of the call will be posted.
Financial results in our earnings release are unaudited, and our remarks include forward-looking statements that are subject to the risks and uncertainties that we discussed in detail in our documents filed with the SEC, specifically the most recent reports on forms 10-K and 10-Q, which identify risk factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from those contained in the forward-looking statements. VeriSign retains its long-standing policy not to comment on financial performance or guidance during the quarter unless it is done through a public disclosure.
The financial results in today's call and the matters we will be discussing today include GAAP and non-GAAP measures used by VeriSign. GAAP and non-GAAP reconciliation information is appended to our earnings release and slide presentation, as applicable, each of which can be found on the Investor Relations section of our website. In a moment, Jim and George will provide some prepared remarks. And afterward, we will open the call for your questions.
With that, I would like to turn the call over to Jim.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thanks, David, and good afternoon, everyone. I am pleased to report another solid quarter for VeriSign. Second quarter results were in line with our objectives of offering security and stability to our customers while generating profitable growth and prov
componenttext:
Thanks, David, and good afternoon, everyone. I am pleased to report another solid quarter for VeriSign. Second quarter results were in line with our objectives of offering security and stability to our customers while generating profitable growth and providing long-term value to our shareholders. We reported revenue of $302 million, up 4.8% year-over-year and delivered solid financial performance, including non-GAAP EPS of $1.18, up 12% year-over-year.
During the second quarter, we continued our share repurchase program by repurchasing 1 million shares for $125 million. Our financial position remains strong with $1.2 billion in cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities at the end of the quarter. We continually evaluate the overall cash and investing needs of the business and consider the best uses for our cash, including potential share repurchases.
At the end of June, the domain name base in .com and .net totaled 149.7 million, consisting of 135.6 million names for .com and 14.1 million names for .net. During the second quarter, we processed 9.6 million new registrations and the domain name base increased by 1.4 million names. Although renewal rates are not fully measurable until 45 days after the end of the quarter, and we believe that the renewal rate for the second quarter of 2018 will be 74.9%. This preliminary rate compares to 74.0% achieved in the second quarter of 2017.
We now expect full year 2018 domain name base growth of between 3.5% and 4.25%, with an increase to the domain name base for the third quarter of 2018 of between 1.3 million and 1.8 million net registrations.
To update you on our discussions about the Cooperative Agreement, VeriSign and NTIA are engaged in dialogue about amending the Cooperative Agreement and what that amendment would look like. But beyond that, we do not have anything else to say at this time.
And now, I'd like to turn the call over to George.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Jim, and good afternoon, everyone.Revenue for the second quarter totaled $302 million, up 4.8% year-over-year and up by 1.1% sequentially. The increase was primarily a result of improved new domain name registrations and improving renewal rates
componenttext:
Thanks, Jim, and good afternoon, everyone.
Revenue for the second quarter totaled $302 million, up 4.8% year-over-year and up by 1.1% sequentially. The increase was primarily a result of improved new domain name registrations and improving renewal rates over the prior year.
Operating income for the period totaled $193 million compared with $175 million in the second quarter of 2017. The operating margin in the quarter came to 63.8% compared to 60.6% in the same quarter a year ago. Net income totaled $128 million compared to $123 million a year earlier, which produced diluted earnings per share of $1.04 in the second quarter this year compared to $0.99 for the same quarter of last year.
As of June 30, 2018, the company maintained total assets of $1.9 billion and total liabilities of $3.3 billion. Assets included $1.2 billion of cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities, of which, $569 million were held domestically with the remainder held abroad.
I'll now review some additional second quarter financial metrics, which include non-GAAP operating margin, non-GAAP earnings per share, operating cash flow and free cash flow. I will then provide updates on our 2018 full year guidance.
As it relates to non-GAAP metrics, second quarter operating expense, which excludes $13 million of stock-based compensation, totaled $96 million compared to $101 million last quarter and $100 million in the same quarter a year ago. Non-GAAP operating margin for the second quarter was 68.2% compared to 66.3% last quarter and 65.3% in the same quarter of 2017.
Non-GAAP net income for the second quarter was $145 million, resulting in non-GAAP diluted earnings per share of $1.18, based on a weighted average diluted share count of 123.2 million shares. This compares to $1.07 last quarter and $1.05 in the second quarter of 2017.
Operating cash flow for the second quarter was $202 million, and free cash flow was $191 million compared with $181 million and $171 million, respectively, for the second quarter last year.
Now, we would like to provide updates to our full year 2018 guidance. Revenue is now expected to be in the range of $1,205,000,000 to $1,215,000,000, narrowed from the $1,200,000,000 to $1,215,000,000 provided on our last call. Non-GAAP operating margin is now expected to be between 66% and 67%, increased from the 65.5% to 66.5% range provided on the last call.
Our non-GAAP interest expense and non-GAAP nonoperating income net is now expected to be an expense of between $82 million and $89 million, decreased from the $85 million and $92 million range provided on our last call. Capital expenditures are still expected to be between $45 million and $55 million. Cash taxes are now expected to be between $80 million and $90 million, narrowed from the $75 million to $95 million range provided on our last call.
In summary, the company continued to demonstrate sound financial performance during the second quarter.
Now, I'll turn the call back to Jim for his closing remarks.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thank you, George. Second quarter was a solid one for VeriSign. There was further expansion of the domain name base and revenues we generated and efficiently returned value to shareholders. We continue to work to protect, grow and manage the business whil
componenttext:
Thank you, George. Second quarter was a solid one for VeriSign. There was further expansion of the domain name base and revenues we generated and efficiently returned value to shareholders. We continue to work to protect, grow and manage the business while continuing our focus on providing long-term value to our shareholders. Last week, the company surpassed 21 continuous years of 100% availability in the common net DNS. This record is the result of the expertise of our people and our specialized infrastructure.
We will now take your questions. Operator, we're ready for the first question.

componenttextpreview: This is actually Ugam Kamat on for Sterling. So just to hit on the Cooperative Agreement, Jim, you mentioned about -- that you are amending the agreement with ICANN. Just so that we are clear on that one, is it ruled out about the possibility of renewing
componenttext: This is actually Ugam Kamat on for Sterling. So just to hit on the Cooperative Agreement, Jim, you mentioned about -- that you are amending the agreement with ICANN. Just so that we are clear on that one, is it ruled out about the possibility of renewing or the contract throwing away? And the third possibility of amending is the one that you are taking moving forward?

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Well, that is the statement that we made. Those others were certainly in the range of possibility. I suppose anything is possible. But the facts, as I sit today, that I can say, speaking for both VeriSign and NTIA is that -- is precisely the statement tha
componenttext: Well, that is the statement that we made. Those others were certainly in the range of possibility. I suppose anything is possible. But the facts, as I sit today, that I can say, speaking for both VeriSign and NTIA is that -- is precisely the statement that I made earlier which is that we are engaged in a dialogue about amending the Cooperative Agreement and what that amendment would look like. And I guess, I would just add that amendments are certainly possible by mutual agreement between NTIA and VeriSign. So again, we're engaged and that's the process we're in currently. Since that process is still ongoing, I can't speculate on what's possible at the end of it, but that's the statement I'm providing today.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Great. I mean, that's helpful. And one on the net additions for the total domain names, you are guiding to something like 4% at the midpoint. I mean, that's the best rates that we have seen so far. Like if you exclude out the -- China in 2015. What is dri
componenttext: Great. I mean, that's helpful. And one on the net additions for the total domain names, you are guiding to something like 4% at the midpoint. I mean, that's the best rates that we have seen so far. Like if you exclude out the -- China in 2015. What is driving that particular increase in the domain? Is it the cross additions that you are seeing or the high renewal rates from the existing customers that is driving that net additions up?

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Sure. This is George. As you saw in the second quarter, we had good performance in net adds from the domain name base. And in the second quarter, that primarily came from improved gross adds. Gross adds were 9.6 million versus 9.2 million a year ago in th
componenttext: Sure. This is George. As you saw in the second quarter, we had good performance in net adds from the domain name base. And in the second quarter, that primarily came from improved gross adds. Gross adds were 9.6 million versus 9.2 million a year ago in the second quarter and slightly improved renewal rates, which were, as Jim mentioned, the preliminary renewal rate for the second quarter is 74.9%, up from 74% a year ago. And we expect those trends to continue here into the third quarter. And that really -- those 2 factors are really are the basis of our guidance.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: All right. And if I could squeeze one more in on the operating margins. I mean 68.2% has been really at the peak of the margins. But you are guiding to 66%, 67% for 2018. Any particular expenses that you expect in the back half of the year that should dra
componenttext: All right. And if I could squeeze one more in on the operating margins. I mean 68.2% has been really at the peak of the margins. But you are guiding to 66%, 67% for 2018. Any particular expenses that you expect in the back half of the year that should drag the margins down from the June quarter level?

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Well, if you look at the second quarter, you can see that our expenses are non-GAAP expenses. We're down about $4 million year-over-year. And as I have mentioned before, quarter-to-quarter, we do have some timing differences with some spend that we put in
componenttext: Well, if you look at the second quarter, you can see that our expenses are non-GAAP expenses. We're down about $4 million year-over-year. And as I have mentioned before, quarter-to-quarter, we do have some timing differences with some spend that we put into the business. And in Q4, it was lower by that $4 million, roughly $3 million of it was in marketing and $1 million was in G&A. But we still expect to be around that $100 million expense going forward. And when we think about where they are, we'll probably see a little bit more in marketing expense go out in subsequent quarters. But we've given -- we really don't guide to quarterly expense or margin. The full year guidance is what we expect will fall between for the remainder of the year.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thank you, operator, and good afternoon, everyone. Welcome to VeriSign's Second Quarter 2018 Earnings Call. With me are Jim Bidzos, Executive Chairman, President and CEO; Todd Strubbe, Executive Vice President and COO; and George Kilguss, Executive Vice P
componenttext:
Thank you, operator, and good afternoon, everyone. Welcome to VeriSign's Second Quarter 2018 Earnings Call. With me are Jim Bidzos, Executive Chairman, President and CEO; Todd Strubbe, Executive Vice President and COO; and George Kilguss, Executive Vice President and CFO. This call and our presentation are being webcast from our Investor Relations website, which is available under About VeriSign on verisign.com. There, you will also find our second quarter 2018 earnings release. At the end of this call, the presentation will be available on that site, and within a few hours, the replay of the call will be posted.
Financial results in our earnings release are unaudited, and our remarks include forward-looking statements that are subject to the risks and uncertainties that we discussed in detail in our documents filed with the SEC, specifically to most recent reports on forms 10-K and 10-Q, which identify risk factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from those contained in the forward-looking statements. VeriSign retains its long-standing policy not to comment on financial performance or guidance during the quarter unless it is done through a public disclosure.
The financial results in today's call and the matter we will be discussing today include GAAP and non-GAAP measures used by VeriSign. GAAP and non-GAAP reconciliation information is appended to our earnings release and slide presentation, as applicable, each of which can be found on the Investor Relations section of our website. In a moment, Jim and George will provide some prepared remarks. And afterwards, we will open the call for your questions. With that, I would like to turn the call over to Jim.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thanks, David, and good afternoon, everyone. I am pleased to report another solid quarter for VeriSign. Second quarter results were in line with our objectives of offering security and stability to our customers while generating profitable growth and prov
componenttext:
Thanks, David, and good afternoon, everyone. I am pleased to report another solid quarter for VeriSign. Second quarter results were in line with our objectives of offering security and stability to our customers while generating profitable growth and providing long-term value to our shareholders. We reported revenue of $302 million, up 4.8% year-over-year and delivered solid financial performance, including non-GAAP EPS of $1.18, up 12% year-over-year. 
During the second quarter, we continued our share repurchase program by repurchasing 1 million shares for $125 million. Our financial position remains strong with $1.2 billion in cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities at the end of the quarter. We continually evaluate the overall cash and investing needs in the business and considered a best uses for our cash, including potential share repurchases. At the end of June, the domain name base in  .com and .net totaled 149.7 million, consisting of 135.6 million names for .com and 14.1 million names for .net. During the second quarter, we processed 9.6 million new registrations and the domain name base increased by 1.4 million names. Although renewal rates are not fully measurable until 45 days after the end of the quarter, and we believe that the renewal rate for the second quarter of 2018 will be 74.9%. This preliminary rate compares to 74.0% achieved in the second quarter of 2017.
We now expect full year 2018 domain name base growth of between 3.5% and 4.25%, with an increase to the domain name base for the third quarter of 2018 of between 1.3 million and 1.8 million net registrations.
To update you on our discussions about the Cooperative Agreement, VeriSign and NTIA are engaged in dialogue about amending the Cooperative Agreement and what that amendment would look like. But beyond that, we don't have anything else to say at this time. And now I'd like to turn the call over to George.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Jim, and good afternoon , everyone. Revenue for the second quarter totaled $302 million, up 4.8% year-over-year and up by 1.1% sequentially. The increase was primarily a result of improved new domain name registrations and improving renewal rates
componenttext:
Thanks, Jim, and good afternoon , everyone. Revenue for the second quarter totaled $302 million, up 4.8% year-over-year and up by 1.1% sequentially. The increase was primarily a result of improved new domain name registrations and improving renewal rates over the prior year. Operating income for the period totaled $193 million compared with $175 million in the second quarter of 2017. The operating margin in the quarter came to 63.8% compared to 60.6% in the same quarter a year ago. Net income totaled $128 million compared to $123 million a year earlier, which produced diluted earnings per share of $1.04 in the second quarter this year compared to $0.99 for the same quarter of last year.
As of June 30, 2018, the company maintained total assets of $1.9 billion and total liabilities of $3.3 billion. Assets included $1.2 billion of cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities, of which, $569 million were held domestically with the remainder held abroad.
I'll now review some additional second quarter financial metrics, which include non-GAAP operating margin, non-GAAP earnings per share, operating cash flow and free cash flow. I will then provide updates on our 2018 full year guidance.
As it relates to non-GAAP metrics, second quarter operating expense, which excludes $13 million of stock-based compensation, totaled $96 million compared to $101 million last quarter and $100 million in the same quarter a year ago. Non-GAAP operating margin for the second quarter was 68.2% compared to 66.3% last quarter and 65.3% in the same quarter of 2017.
Non-GAAP net income for the second quarter was $145 million, resulting in non-GAAP diluted earnings per share of $1.18, based on a weighted average diluted share count of 123.2 million shares. This compares to $1.07 last quarter and $1.05 in the second quarter of 2017.
Operating cash flow for the second quarter was $202 million, and free cash flow was $191 million compared with $181 million and $171 million, respectively, for the second quarter last year. 
Now we would like to provide updates to our full year 2018 guidance. Revenue is now expected to be in the range of $1,205,000,000 to $1,215,000,000, narrowed from the $1,200,000,000 to $1,215,000,000 provided in our last call. Non-GAAP operating margin is now expected to be between 66% and 67%, increased from the 65.5% to 66.5% range provided on the last call.
Our non-GAAP interest expense and non-GAAP nonoperating income net is now expected to be an expense of between $82 million and $89 million, decreased from the $85 million and $92 million range provided on our last call. Capital expenditures are still expected to be between $45 million and $55 million. Cash taxes are now expected to be between $80 million and $90 million, narrowed from the $75 million to $95 million range provided on our last call. In summary, the company continued to demonstrate sound financial performance during the second quarter. Now I'll turn the call back over to Jim for his closing remarks.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thank you, George. Second quarter was a solid one for VeriSign. There was further expansion of the domain name base and revenues we generated and efficiently return value to shareholders. We continue to work to protect, grow and manage the business while
componenttext: Thank you, George. Second quarter was a solid one for VeriSign. There was further expansion of the domain name base and revenues we generated and efficiently return value to shareholders. We continue to work to protect, grow and manage the business while continuing our focus on providing long-term value to our shareholders. Last week, the company surpassed 21 continuous years of 100% availability under in the common net DNS. This record is a result of the expertise of our people and our specialized infrastructure. We will now take your questions. Operator, we're ready for the first question.

componenttext: Well, if you look at the second quarter, you can see that our expenses are non-GAAP expenses. We're down about $4 million year-over-year. And as I have mentioned before, quarter-to-quarter, we do have some timing differences with some spend that we put into the business. And in Q4, it was lower by that $4 million, roughly $3 million of it was in marketing and $1 million was in G&A. But we still expect to be around that $100 million expense going forward. And when we think about where they are, we'll probably see a little bit more in marketing expense go out in subsequent quarters. But we've given -- we really don't guide to quarterly expense or margin. The full year guidance is what we expect will fall between for the remainder of the year.

componenttext:
Thanks, David, and good afternoon, everyone. I am pleased to report another solid quarter for VeriSign. Second quarter results were in line with our objectives of offering security and stability to our customers while generating profitable growth and providing long-term value to our shareholders. We reported revenue of $302 million, up 4.8% year-over-year and delivered solid financial performance, including non-GAAP EPS of $1.18, up 12% year-over-year.
During the second quarter, we continued our share repurchase program by repurchasing 1 million shares for $125 million. Our financial position remains strong with $1.2 billion in cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities at the end of the quarter. We continually evaluate the overall cash and investing needs of the business and consider the best uses for our cash, including potential share repurchases.
At the end of June, the domain name base in .com and .net totaled [ 149.7 million ], consisting of 135.6 million names for .com and 14.1 million names for .net. During the second quarter, we processed 9.6 million new registrations and the domain name base increased by 1.4 million names. Although renewal rates are not fully measurable until 45 days after the end of the quarter, and we believe that the renewal rate for the second quarter of 2018 will be 74.9%, this preliminary rate compares to 74.0% achieved in the second quarter of 2017.
We now expect full year 2018 domain name base growth of between 3.5% and 4.25% with an increase to the domain name base for the third quarter of 2018 of between 1.3 million and 1.8 million net registrations.
To update you on our discussions about the Cooperative Agreement, VeriSign and NTIA are engaged in dialogue about amending the Cooperative Agreement and what that amendment would look like. But beyond that, we do not have anything else to say at this time.
And now, I'd like to turn the call over to George.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Jim, and good afternoon, everyone.Revenue for the second quarter totaled $302 million, up 4.8% year-over-year and up by 1.1% sequentially. The increase was primarily a result of improved new domain name registrations and improving renewal rates
componenttext:
Thanks, Jim, and good afternoon, everyone.
Revenue for the second quarter totaled $302 million, up 4.8% year-over-year and up by 1.1% sequentially. The increase was primarily a result of improved new domain name registrations and improving renewal rates over the prior year.
Operating income for the period totaled $193 million compared with $175 million in the second quarter of 2017. The operating margin in the quarter came to 63.8% compared to 60.6% in the same quarter a year ago. Net income totaled $128 million compared to $123 million a year earlier, which produced diluted earnings per share of $1.04 in the second quarter this year compared to $0.99 for the same quarter of last year.
As of June 30, 2018, the company maintained total assets of $1.9 billion and total liabilities of $3.3 billion. Assets included $1.2 billion of cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities, of which $569 million were held domestically with the remainder held abroad.
I'll now review some additional second quarter financial metrics, which include non-GAAP operating margin, non-GAAP earnings per share, operating cash flow and free cash flow. I will then provide updates on our 2018 full year guidance.
As it relates to non-GAAP metrics, second quarter operating expense, which excludes $13 million of stock-based compensation, totaled $96 million compared to $101 million last quarter and $100 million in the same quarter a year ago. Non-GAAP operating margin for the second quarter was 68.2% compared to 66.3% last quarter and 65.3% in the same quarter of 2017.
Non-GAAP net income for the second quarter was $145 million, resulting in non-GAAP diluted earnings per share of $1.18, based on a weighted average diluted share count of 123.2 million shares. This compares to $1.07 last quarter and $1.05 in the second quarter of 2017.
Operating cash flow for the second quarter was $202 million, and free cash flow was $191 million compared with $181 million and $171 million, respectively, for the second quarter last year.
Now, we would like to provide updates to our full year 2018 guidance. Revenue is now expected to be in the range of $1,205,000,000 to $1,215,000,000, narrowed from the $1,200,000,000 to $1,215,000,000 provided on our last call. Non-GAAP operating margin is now expected to be between 66% and 67%, increased from the 65.5% to 66.5% range provided on the last call.
Our non-GAAP interest expense and non-GAAP nonoperating income net is now expected to be an expense of between $82 million and $89 million, decreased from the $85 million and $92 million range provided on our last call. Capital expenditures are still expected to be between $45 million and $55 million. Cash taxes are now expected to be between $80 million and $90 million, narrowed from the $75 million to $95 million range provided on our last call.
In summary, the company continued to demonstrate sound financial performance during the second quarter.
Now, I'll turn the call back to Jim for his closing remarks.

componenttextpreview: Thank you, George. Second quarter was a solid one for VeriSign. There was further expansion of the domain name base and revenues we generated and efficiently returned value to shareholders. We continued our work to protect, grow and manage the business wh
componenttext:
Thank you, George. Second quarter was a solid one for VeriSign. There was further expansion of the domain name base and revenues we generated and efficiently returned value to shareholders. We continued our work to protect, grow and manage the business while continuing our focus on providing long-term value to our shareholders. Last week, the company surpassed 21 continuous years of 100% availability in the common net DNS. This record is the result of the expertise of our people and our specialized infrastructure.

componenttext: Well, if you look at the second quarter, you can see that our expenses are non-GAAP expenses. We're down about $4 million year-over-year. And as I have mentioned before, quarter-to-quarter, we do have some timing differences with some spend that we put into the business. And in Q4, it was lower by that $4 million, roughly $3 million of it was in marketing and $1 million was in G&A. But we still expect to be around that $100 million expense going forward. And when we think about where they are, we'll probably see a little bit more in marketing expense go out in subsequent quarters. But we've given -- we really don't guide to quarterly expense or margin. The full-year guidance is what we expect will fall between for the remainder of the year.

componenttext:
Good day, everyone. Welcome to VeriSign's Second Quarter 2018 Earnings Call. Today's conference is being recorded, and unauthorized recording of this call is not permitted.
At this time, I'd like to turn the conference over to Mr. David Atchley, Vice President of Investor Relations and Corporate Treasurer. Please go ahead, sir.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thank you, operator, and good afternoon, everyone. Welcome to VeriSign's Second Quarter 2018 Earnings Call. With me are Jim Bidzos, Executive Chairman, President and CEO; Todd Strubbe, Executive Vice President and COO; and George Kilguss, Executive Vice P
componenttext:
Thank you, operator, and good afternoon, everyone. Welcome to VeriSign's Second Quarter 2018 Earnings Call. With me are Jim Bidzos, Executive Chairman, President and CEO; Todd Strubbe, Executive Vice President and COO; and George Kilguss, Executive Vice President and CFO.
This call and our presentation are being webcast from our Investor Relations website, which is available under About VeriSign on verisign.com. There, you will also find our second quarter 2018 earnings release. At the end of this call, the presentation will be available on that site, and within a few hours, the replay of the call will be posted.
Financial results in our earnings release are unaudited, and our remarks include forward-looking statements that are subject to the risks and uncertainties that we discussed in detail in our documents filed with the SEC, specifically the most recent reports on forms 10-K and 10-Q, which identify risk factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from those contained in the forward-looking statements. VeriSign retains its long-standing policy not to comment on financial performance or guidance during the quarter unless it is done through a public disclosure.
The financial results in today's call and the matters we will be discussing today include GAAP and non-GAAP measures used by VeriSign. GAAP and non-GAAP reconciliation information is appended to our earnings release and slide presentation, as applicable, each of which can be found on the Investor Relations section of our website. In a moment, Jim and George will provide some prepared remarks. And afterward, we will open the call for your questions.
With that, I would like to turn the call over to Jim.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thanks, David, and good afternoon, everyone. I am pleased to report another solid quarter for VeriSign. Second quarter results were in line with our objectives of offering security and stability to our customers while generating profitable growth and prov
componenttext:
Thanks, David, and good afternoon, everyone. I am pleased to report another solid quarter for VeriSign. Second quarter results were in line with our objectives of offering security and stability to our customers while generating profitable growth and providing long-term value to our shareholders. We reported revenue of $302 million, up 4.8% year-over-year and delivered solid financial performance, including non-GAAP EPS of $1.18, up 12% year-over-year.
During the second quarter, we continued our share repurchase program by repurchasing 1 million shares for $125 million. Our financial position remains strong with $1.2 billion in cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities at the end of the quarter. We continually evaluate the overall cash and investing needs of the business and consider the best uses for our cash, including potential share repurchases.
At the end of June, the domain name base in .com and .net totaled 149.7 million, consisting of 135.6 million names for .com and 14.1 million names for .net. During the second quarter, we processed 9.6 million new registrations and the domain name base increased by 1.4 million names. Although renewal rates are not fully measurable until 45 days after the end of the quarter, and we believe that the renewal rate for the second quarter of 2018 will be 74.9%. This preliminary rate compares to 74.0% achieved in the second quarter of 2017.
We now expect full year 2018 domain name base growth of between 3.5% and 4.25% with an increase to the domain name base for the third quarter of 2018 of between 1.3 million and 1.8 million net registrations.
To update you on our discussions about the Cooperative Agreement, VeriSign and NTIA are engaged in dialogue about amending the Cooperative Agreement and what that amendment would look like. But beyond that, we do not have anything else to say at this time.
And now I'd like to turn the call over to George.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Jim, and good afternoon, everyone.Revenue for the second quarter totaled $302 million, up 4.8% year-over-year and up by 1.1% sequentially. The increase was primarily a result of improved new domain name registrations and improving renewal rates
componenttext:
Thanks, Jim, and good afternoon, everyone.
Revenue for the second quarter totaled $302 million, up 4.8% year-over-year and up by 1.1% sequentially. The increase was primarily a result of improved new domain name registrations and improving renewal rates over the prior year.
Operating income for the period totaled $193 million compared with $175 million in the second quarter of 2017. The operating margin in the quarter came to 63.8% compared to 60.6% in the same quarter a year ago. Net income totaled $128 million compared to $123 million a year earlier, which produced diluted earnings per share of $1.04 in the second quarter this year compared to $0.99 for the same quarter of last year.
As of June 30, 2018, the company maintained total assets of $1.9 billion and total liabilities of $3.3 billion. Assets included $1.2 billion of cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities, of which $569 million were held domestically with the remainder held abroad.
I'll now review some additional second quarter financial metrics, which include non-GAAP operating margin, non-GAAP earnings per share, operating cash flow and free cash flow. I will then provide updates on our 2018 full year guidance.
As it relates to non-GAAP metrics, second quarter operating expense, which excludes $13 million of stock-based compensation, totaled $96 million compared to $101 million last quarter and $100 million in the same quarter a year ago. Non-GAAP operating margin for the second quarter was 68.2% compared to 66.3% last quarter and 65.3% in the same quarter of 2017.
Non-GAAP net income for the second quarter was $145 million, resulting in non-GAAP diluted earnings per share of $1.18, based on a weighted average diluted share count of 123.2 million shares. This compares to $1.07 last quarter and $1.05 in the second quarter of 2017.
Operating cash flow for the second quarter was $202 million, and free cash flow was $191 million compared with $181 million and $171 million, respectively, for the second quarter last year.
Now we would like to provide updates to our full year 2018 guidance. Revenue is now expected to be in the range of $1,205,000,000 to $1,215,000,000, narrowed from the $1,200,000,000 to $1,215,000,000 provided on our last call. Non-GAAP operating margin is now expected to be between 66% and 67%, increased from the 65.5% to 66.5% range provided on the last call.
Our non-GAAP interest expense and non-GAAP nonoperating income net is now expected to be an expense of between $82 million and $89 million, decreased from the $85 million and $92 million range provided on our last call. Capital expenditures are still expected to be between $45 million and $55 million. Cash taxes are now expected to be between $80 million and $90 million, narrowed from the $75 million to $95 million range provided on our last call.
In summary, the company continued to demonstrate sound financial performance during the second quarter.
Now I'll turn the call back to Jim for his closing remarks.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q2 2018 Earnings Call, Jul 26, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thank you, George. Second quarter was a solid one for VeriSign. There was further expansion of the domain name base and revenues we generated and efficiently returned value to shareholders. We continued our work to protect, grow and manage the business wh
componenttext:
Thank you, George. Second quarter was a solid one for VeriSign. There was further expansion of the domain name base and revenues we generated and efficiently returned value to shareholders. We continued our work to protect, grow and manage the business while continuing our focus on providing long-term value to our shareholders. Last week, the company surpassed 21 continuous years of 100% availability in the common net DNS. This record is the result of the expertise of our people and our specialized infrastructure.
We will now take your questions. Operator, we're ready for the first question.

Good day, everyone, and welcome to VeriSign's Third Quarter 2018 Earnings Call. Today's conference is being recorded, and unauthorized recording of this call is not permitted.
At this time, I would like to turn the conference over to Mr. David Atchley, Vice President of Investor Relations and Corporate Treasurer. Please go ahead, sir.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thank you, operator, and good afternoon, everyone. Welcome to VeriSign's Third Quarter 2018 Earnings Call.With me are Jim Bidzos, Executive Chairman, President and CEO; Todd Strubbe, Executive Vice President and COO; and George Kilguss, Executive Vice P
componenttext:
Thank you, operator, and good afternoon, everyone. Welcome to VeriSign's Third Quarter 2018 Earnings Call.
With me are Jim Bidzos, Executive Chairman, President and CEO; Todd Strubbe, Executive Vice President and COO; and George Kilguss, Executive Vice President and CFO.
This call and our presentation are being webcast from our Investor Relations website, which is available under About VeriSign on verisign.com. There, you will also find our third quarter 2018 earnings release. At the end of this call, the presentation will be available on that site, and within a few hours, the replay of the call will be posted.
Financial results in our earnings release are unaudited, and our remarks include forward-looking statements that are subject to the risks and uncertainties that we discussed in detail in our documents filed with the SEC, specifically the most recent reports on forms 10-K and 10-Q, which identify risk factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from those contained in the forward-looking statements. VeriSign retains its long-standing policy not to comment on financial performance or guidance during the quarter unless it is done through a public disclosure.
The financial results in today's call and the matters we will be discussing today include GAAP and non-GAAP measures used by VeriSign. GAAP to non-GAAP reconciliation information is appended to our earnings release and slide presentation, as applicable, each of which can be found on the Investor Relations section of our website.
In a moment, Jim and George will provide some prepared remarks. And afterward, we will open the call for your questions.
With that, I would like to turn the call over to Jim.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thanks, David, and good afternoon, everyone. I'm pleased to report another solid quarter for VeriSign. Third quarter results were in line with our objectives of offering security and stability to our customers, while generating profitable growth and provi
componenttext:
Thanks, David, and good afternoon, everyone. I'm pleased to report another solid quarter for VeriSign. Third quarter results were in line with our objectives of offering security and stability to our customers, while generating profitable growth and providing long-term value to our shareholders. 
We reported revenue of $306 million, up 4.6% year-over-year and delivered solid financial performance, including non-GAAP EPS of $1.23, up 23% year-over-year. 
During the third quarter, we continued our share repurchase program by repurchasing 1.1 million shares for $175 million. Our financial position remains strong with $1.2 billion in cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities at the end of the quarter. We continually evaluate the overall cash and investing needs of the business and consider the best uses for our cash, including potential share repurchases. 
At the end of September, the domain name base and .com and .net totaled $151.7 million, consisting of $137.6 million names for.com and $14.1 million names for .net. 
During the third quarter, we processed 9.5 million new registrations and the domain name base increased by 2 million names.  Although renewal rates are not fully measurable until 45 days after the end of the quarter, we believe that the renewal rate for the third quarter of 2018 will be 75%. This preliminary rate compares to 74.4% achieved in the year ago quarter. 
We now expect full year 2018 domain name base growth of between 4.2% and 4.6% with an increase to the domain name base for the fourth quarter of 2018 of between 0.9 million to 1.4 million net additions. 
Beginning with 2019 guidance, on our next earnings call, we plan to focus our guidance related to changes in the domain name base on annual changes. Starting next year, we no longer intend to provide guidance on quarterly net additions. This change reflects our commitment to managing the business for long-term growth and stability, while aligning all of our guidance to be focused on key annual business and financial metrics. 
The daily transparency into net additions to the domain name base, which is updated twice per day, will continue to be available on our website. As indicated in our earnings release today, we have entered into any agreement with NeuStar to sell the rights, economic benefits and obligations in all customer contracts related to our Security Services business. Transaction includes the sale of customer agreements related to our DDOS protection, managed DNS, DNS Firewall and Recursive DNS services. We will retain our proprietary technology, network assets, critical infrastructure, software and public DNS service to focus solely on supporting our core mission, which is ensuring the security, stability and resiliency of our core infrastructure. 
As part of the transaction, we will continue to support the Security Services customers during the transition to NeuStar pursuant to a transition services agreement that is expected to be executed at closing. The transaction is subject to customary regulatory approval and is expected to close shortly following receipt of such approval. 
We are committed to focusing on our core mission of providing critical Internet infrastructure, including routes on management, operation of 2 of the 13 Global Internet root servers, operation of .gov and .edu and authoritative resolution for the.com and .net top-level domains, which support the majority of global e-commerce. For this reason, we're transitioning about Security Services customers to NeuStar. 
To update you on our discussions about the Cooperative Agreement, we are mindful of the upcoming exploration and are progressing with the NTIA is to amend the cooperation agreement by mutual agreement. When we are able to provide more information, we will do so. I will tell you that we are confident that an M&A agreement can be executed before the expiration of the current term, which is the end of November. However, until that process is complete, there is nothing more that we can disclose at this time. 
And now, I would like to turn the call over to George.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Jim, and good afternoon, everyone. Revenue for the third quarter totaled $306 million, up 4.6% year-over-year and up by 1.1% sequentially. Operating income for the period totaled $195 million compared with $181 million in the third quarter of 20
componenttext:
Thanks, Jim, and good afternoon, everyone. Revenue for the third quarter totaled $306 million, up 4.6% year-over-year and up by 1.1% sequentially. 
Operating income for the period totaled $195 million compared with $181 million in the third quarter of 2017. The operating margin in the quarter came to 63.8% compared to 61.9% in the same quarter a year ago. 
Net income totaled $138 million compared to $115 million a year earlier, which produced diluted earnings per share of $1.13 in the third quarter this year compared to $0.93 for the same quarter last year. 
As of September 30, 2018, the company maintained total assets of $1.9 billion and total liabilities of $3.3 billion. Assets included $1.2 billion of cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities, of which $508 million were held domestically with the remainder held abroad. 
I'll now review some additional third quarter financial metrics, which include non-GAAP operating margin, non-GAAP earnings per share, operating cash flow and free cash flow. I will then provide updates on our 2018 full year guidance. 
As it relates to non-GAAP metrics, third quarter operating expense, which excludes $15 million of stock-based compensation, totaled $96 million, the same as last quarter and compared to $97 million in the third quarter a year ago. 
Non-GAAP operating margin for the third quarter was 68.7% compared to 68.2% last quarter and 66.7% in the same quarter of 2017. Non-GAAP net income for the third quarter was $151 million, resulting in non-GAAP diluted earnings per share of $1.23, based on a weighted average diluted share count of 122.3 million shares. This compares to $1.18 last quarter and $1 in the third quarter of 2017. 
Operating cash flow for the third quarter was $187 million and free cash flow was $177 million compared with $175 million and $153 million, respectively, for the third quarter last year. 
Now I'd like to provide updates to our full year 2018 guidance. Revenue is now expected to be in the range of $1,211,000,000 to $1,216,000,000 increased and narrowed from the $1,205,000,000 and $1,215,000,000 provided on our last call. 
Non-GAAP operating margin is now expected to be between 67% and 67.5%, increased and narrowed from the 66% to 67% range provided on the last call. Our non-GAAP interest expense and non-GAAP nonoperating income net is now expected to be an expense of between $80 million to $84 million, decreased and narrowed from the $82 million to $89 million range provided on our last call. 
Capital expenditures are now expected to be between $40 million and $50 million, decreased from the $45 million to $55 million range provided on our last call. 
Cash taxes are still expected to be between $80 million and $90 million, unchanged from our last call. 
In summary, the company continued to demonstrate sound financial performance during the third quarter. Now I'll turn the call back to Jim for his closing remarks.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018

componenttext: Thank you, George. The third quarter was another solid quarter for VeriSign. There was further expansion of the domain name base and revenues we generated and efficiently returned value to our shareholders. We continued to work to protect, grow and manage the business, while continuing our focus on providing long-term value to our shareholders. Will now take your questions. Operator, we're ready for the first question.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: All right. If I could squeeze one last one in. If you see the operating margins for the current quarter, you see that much of the leverage came from sales and marketing expense. Is it something where it will be the normal course of business that we see su
componenttext: All right. If I could squeeze one last one in. If you see the operating margins for the current quarter, you see that much of the leverage came from sales and marketing expense. Is it something where it will be the normal course of business that we see such kind of margins? I know we provided 2018 guidance, but from a qualitative perspective, was there a shift of timing of expenses in the quarter or is it like more that the focus of the business in terms of the investments has changed?

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: With regard to our Q3 expenses, as you can see from a non-GAAP basis, our total expenses were about $96 million and we're relatively flat both year-over-year and sequentially. However, as you point out, we did see some movement between the categories sequ
componenttext: With regard to our Q3 expenses, as you can see from a non-GAAP basis, our total expenses were about $96 million and we're relatively flat both year-over-year and sequentially. However, as you point out, we did see some movement between the categories sequentially. We did have a sliding decrease in sales and marketing, which is offset by small increases in G&A and cost of goods sold. Now specifically, the sales and marketing, sequentially, we were down about $2.5 million quarter-to-quarter and that primarily was a result of lower direct marketing activity in the quarter. As you may recall, we increased our direct marketing activities in late 2017 with the intent to do more in 2018. However, as we pursue more direct marketing activities outside of the U.S., we found it took and it is taking frankly us longer to execute on those direct marketing activities abroad. So really, no change. Just I would say the normal abend floor of how marketing expenses get deployed into the marketplace.

Is it still a priority to get to that level deployed, those marketing expenses deployed? So that is something we should expect to tick back up going forward and maybe 2019?

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: As I said earlier, we'll provide 2019 guidance on our next call. But look, we are constantly trying to invest in marketing activities. I think the goal there is for domain name sales to increase with marketing activities and a we pursue activities that we
componenttext: As I said earlier, we'll provide 2019 guidance on our next call. But look, we are constantly trying to invest in marketing activities. I think the goal there is for domain name sales to increase with marketing activities and a we pursue activities that we think will drive those results. We have switched year-over-year with more direct marketing this year that we've done done in prior years and I just think we've executed some great campaigns in a variety of markets, but as I said, sometimes international markets are taking a little bit longer to get that worked through. I don't think anything is any different than their peers we continue to focus and make investments in marketing and hopefully, that produces and increases domain name sales.

componenttext: And then my second question was on, Jim, the number of new names processes picked up nicely this year and been kind of $9.5 million or above each quarter. What's been driving do you think? Was there any trends or high-level comments you could say driving the increase in the number of domains this year?

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: I'll ask George to comment. I will just say that com is an incredible strong brand. You hear me say this all the time and I can't emphasize it quite frankly. It's a brand that gets a tremendous amount of exposure. It's the brand that gives you credibility
componenttext: I'll ask George to comment. I will just say that com is an incredible strong brand. You hear me say this all the time and I can't emphasize it quite frankly. It's a brand that gets a tremendous amount of exposure. It's the brand that gives you credibility worldwide for your online presence, and I think that is a great deal to do with the continued strength that com is showing, but George, if you would like to add the color, please feel free.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: As you've observed, Q3 was a good quarter for us. We delivered 2 million net ads in the quarter, which was up from 1.5 million net ads in the third quarter of 2017 and that improvement is primarily a result of gross adds. As you pointed out, gross ads tot
componenttext: As you've observed, Q3 was a good quarter for us. We delivered 2 million net ads in the quarter, which was up from 1.5 million net ads in the third quarter of 2017 and that improvement is primarily a result of gross adds. As you pointed out, gross ads totaled 9.5 million a quarter, they were up from 8.9 million a year ago. And this is really the same trend that we've witnessed and reported on pretty much all year. We've had a continued gross adds performance from both North America and China registrars. They just seems to be performing better this year than they did previously and that's been a trend that we have seen in previous quarters and it is continued here for the third quarter. So again, I think, it is the strong brand and in both those markets and will continue to execute on marketing executive and back activities to accentuate that brand message to the marketplace.

componenttext:
Thank you, George. The third quarter was another solid quarter for VeriSign. There was further expansion on the domain name base and revenues we generated and efficiently returned value to our shareholders. We continue to work to protect, grow and manage the business, while continuing our focus on providing long-term value to our shareholders.
We'll now take your questions. Operator, we're ready for the first question.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: [Operator Instructions] And we will go first to Sterling Auty at JP Morgan.
componenttext: [Operator Instructions] And we will go first to Sterling Auty at JP Morgan.

componenttext: This is actually Ugam Kamat on for Sterling. So you mentioned about your agreement with NeuStar to actually sell your Security Service. Just so that we can model the out years perfectly, how much revenue were you getting from that other business? And how much margins did that particular business have?

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Ugam, this is George. Thanks for the question. As I'm sure you're aware, VSS is not a material contributor to our overall business. If the transaction closes before year-end, we do not expect a material impact to our 2018 guidance. And we will provide 201
componenttext: Ugam, this is George. Thanks for the question. As I'm sure you're aware, VSS is not a material contributor to our overall business. If the transaction closes before year-end, we do not expect a material impact to our 2018 guidance. And we will provide 2019 full year guidance on our Q4 call, which will include any impacts from the transaction once it closes.

And on the Cooperative Agreement, you mentioned that it can be amended before the expiration date, but given -- if suppose say, the process continues, is there a provision where the -- like Cooperative Agreement can be extended for 6 months until which you are in the negotiation period?

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: I don't have any comments beyond my prepared remarks. So I'll just reiterate that we're progressing with the NTIA to amend the Cooperative Agreement by mutual agreement and that we're confident that an amended agreement can be executed before the expirati
componenttext: I don't have any comments beyond my prepared remarks. So I'll just reiterate that we're progressing with the NTIA to amend the Cooperative Agreement by mutual agreement and that we're confident that an amended agreement can be executed before the expiration of the current term at the end of November, so more when we can.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: All right. And if I could squeeze one last one in. If you see the operating margins for the current quarter, you see that much of the leverage came from sales and marketing expense. Is it something where it is -- it will be the normal course of business t
componenttext: All right. And if I could squeeze one last one in. If you see the operating margins for the current quarter, you see that much of the leverage came from sales and marketing expense. Is it something where it is -- it will be the normal course of business that we see such kind of margins? I know you provided 2018 guidance, but just from a qualitative perspective, was there a shift of timing of expenses in the quarter? Or is it like more that the focus of the business in terms of the investments has changed?

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: With regard to our Q3 expenses, as you can see out from a non-GAAP basis, our total expenses were about $96 million and we're relatively flat both year-over-year and sequentially. However, as you point out, we did see some movements between the categories
componenttext: With regard to our Q3 expenses, as you can see out from a non-GAAP basis, our total expenses were about $96 million and we're relatively flat both year-over-year and sequentially. However, as you point out, we did see some movements between the categories sequentially. We did have a slight decrease in sales and marketing, which was offset by small increases in G&A and cost of goods sold. Now specifically, the sales and marketing, sequentially, we were down about $2.5 million quarter-to-quarter and that primarily was a result of lower direct marketing activities in the quarter. As you may recall, we increased our direct marketing activities late in 2017 with the intent to do more in 2018. However, as we pursue more direct marketing activities outside of the U.S., we found it took and it is taking frankly us longer to execute on those direct marketing activities abroad. So really, no change. Just I would say the normal ebb and flow of how marketing expenses get deployed into the marketplace.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: And we will go next to Matthew Wells at Citi.
componenttext: And we will go next to Matthew Wells at Citi.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: This is Matt Wells and I'm on for Walter Pritchard. I was just curious what was the catalyst for transitioning your Security Services business to NeuStar? Is there anything that read into the timing here relative to the Coop?
componenttext: This is Matt Wells and I'm on for Walter Pritchard. I was just curious what was the catalyst for transitioning your Security Services business to NeuStar? Is there anything that read into the timing here relative to the Coop?

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: No. This is completely independent. It's a decision we made to focus exclusively on our core mission. As you know, we operate a great deal of critical infrastructure where we do resolution, of course, not only for com and net but for .gov and .edu, we do
componenttext: No. This is completely independent. It's a decision we made to focus exclusively on our core mission. As you know, we operate a great deal of critical infrastructure where we do resolution, of course, not only for com and net but for .gov and .edu, we do Root Zone management, we operate 2 of the 13 Internet root servers. And we just decided that focus wasn't consistent with continued pursuit of that business and then transitioning it to NeuStar made sense for that reason, timing independent of anything else that's going on.

componenttext: That's helpful. And I know, I think last time we spoke the .web process was still hung up with ICANN and timing sounded like it was a little uncertain. Do you have any more clarity on that process or where it stands?

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: It's Matt Lemenager on for Rob. So my question was on the sales and marketing expenses. Well, George, you mentioned that it was taking a little longer to execute, is that something should we expect that to kind of tick back up? Is it still a priority to g
componenttext: It's Matt Lemenager on for Rob. So my question was on the sales and marketing expenses. Well, George, you mentioned that it was taking a little longer to execute, is that something should we expect that to kind of tick back up? Is it still a priority to get that, that level deployed, those marketing expenses deployed? So is that something we should expect to tick back up going forward and maybe into 2019?

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: We'll -- as I've said earlier, we'll provide 2019 guidance on our next call. But look, we are constantly trying to invest in marketing activities. I think the goal there is for domain name sales to increase with marketing activities and we clearly pursue
componenttext: We'll -- as I've said earlier, we'll provide 2019 guidance on our next call. But look, we are constantly trying to invest in marketing activities. I think the goal there is for domain name sales to increase with marketing activities and we clearly pursue activities that we think will drive those results. We have switched year-over-year, we've done more direct marketing this year than we've done in prior years. And I just think we're -- we've executed some great campaigns in a variety of markets, but as I said, sometimes the international markets are taking a little bit longer to get that, that worked through. So I don't think anything is really different there. We continue to focus and make investments in marketing, and hopefully, that produces increases in domain name sales.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then my second question was on, Jim, the number of new names process has ticked up nicely this year and been kind of 9.5 million or above each quarter. What's been driving you think? Was there any trends or any higher level comments that you cou
componenttext: Okay. And then my second question was on, Jim, the number of new names process has ticked up nicely this year and been kind of 9.5 million or above each quarter. What's been driving you think? Was there any trends or any higher level comments that you could say driving the increase in the number of domains this year?

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: I'll ask George to comment. I will just say that com is an incredibly strong brand. You hear me say this all the time and I can't emphasize it enough quite frankly. It's a brand that gets a tremendous amount of exposure. It's the brand that gives you cred
componenttext: I'll ask George to comment. I will just say that com is an incredibly strong brand. You hear me say this all the time and I can't emphasize it enough quite frankly. It's a brand that gets a tremendous amount of exposure. It's the brand that gives you credibility worldwide for your online presence, and I think that has a great deal to do with the continued strength that com is showing, but then George, if you would like to add some color, please feel free.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Yes, sure. Matt, as you've observed, Q3 was a good quarter for us. We delivered 2 million net adds in the quarter, which was up from 1.5 million net adds in the third quarter of 2017 and that improvement is primarily a result of gross adds. As you point o
componenttext: Yes, sure. Matt, as you've observed, Q3 was a good quarter for us. We delivered 2 million net adds in the quarter, which was up from 1.5 million net adds in the third quarter of 2017 and that improvement is primarily a result of gross adds. As you point out, our gross adds totaled 9.5 million in the quarter, they were up from 8.9 million a year ago. And this is really the same trend that we've witnessed and reported on pretty much all year. We've had continued gross adds performance from both North American and China registrars. They seem to be performing better this year than they did previously and that's been the trend that we've seen in previous quarters and it's continued here into the third quarter. So again, I think, it's the strong brand in both those markets and will continue to execute on marketing activities to accentuate that brand message into the marketplace.

Good day, everyone, and welcome to VeriSign's Third Quarter 2018 Earnings Call. Today's conference is being recorded, and an unauthorized recording of this call is not permitted.
At this time, I would like to turn the conference over to Mr. David Atchley, Vice President of Investor Relations and Corporate Treasurer. Please go ahead, sir.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thank you, operator, and good afternoon, everyone. Welcome to VeriSign's Third Quarter 2018 Earnings Call.With me are Jim Bidzos, Executive Chairman, President and CEO; Todd Strubbe, Executive Vice President and COO; and George Kilguss, Executive Vice P
componenttext:
Thank you, operator, and good afternoon, everyone. Welcome to VeriSign's Third Quarter 2018 Earnings Call.
With me are Jim Bidzos, Executive Chairman, President and CEO; Todd Strubbe, Executive Vice President and COO; and George Kilguss, Executive Vice President and CFO.
This call and our presentation are being webcast from our Investor Relations website, which is available under About VeriSign on verisign.com. There you will also find our third quarter 2018 earnings release. At the end of this call, the presentation will be available on that site, and within a few hours, the replay of the call will be posted.
Financial results in our earnings release are unaudited, and our remarks include forward-looking statements that are subject to the risks and uncertainties that we discuss in detail in our documents filed with the SEC, specifically the most recent reports on forms 10-K and 10-Q, which identify risk factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from those contained in the forward-looking statements. VeriSign retains its long-standing policy not to comment on financial performance or guidance during the quarter unless it is done through a public disclosure.
The financial results in today's call and the matters we will be discussing today include GAAP and non-GAAP measures used by VeriSign. GAAP to non-GAAP reconciliation information is appended to our earnings release and slide presentation, as applicable, each of which can be found in the Investor Relations section of our website.
In a moment, Jim and George will provide some prepared remarks. And afterward, we will open the call for your questions.
With that, I would like to turn the call over to Jim.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thanks, David, and good afternoon, everyone. I'm pleased to report another solid quarter for VeriSign. Third quarter results were in line with our objectives of offering security and stability to our customers, while generating profitable growth and provi
componenttext:
Thanks, David, and good afternoon, everyone. I'm pleased to report another solid quarter for VeriSign. Third quarter results were in line with our objectives of offering security and stability to our customers, while generating profitable growth and providing long-term value to our shareholders.
We reported revenue of $306 million, up 4.6% year-over-year and delivered solid financial performance, including non-GAAP EPS of $1.23, up 23% year-over-year.
During the third quarter, we continued our share repurchase program by repurchasing 1.1 million shares for $175 million. Our financial position remains strong with $1.2 billion in cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities at the end of the quarter. We continually evaluate the overall cash and investing needs of the business and consider the best uses for our cash, including potential share repurchases.
At the end of September, the domain name [ base in .com and .net ] totaled 151.7 million, consisting of 137.6 million names for .com and 14.1 million names for .net.
During the third quarter, we processed 9.5 million new registrations and the domain name base increased by 2 million names.  Although renewal rates are not fully measurable until 45 days after the end of the quarter, we believe that the renewal rate for the third quarter of 2018 will be 75%. This preliminary rate compares to 74.4% achieved in the year ago quarter.
We now expect full year 2018 domain name base growth of between 4.2% and 4.6% with an increase to the domain name base for the fourth quarter of 2018 of between 0.9 million to 1.4 million net additions.
Beginning with 2019 guidance, on our next earnings call, we plan to focus our guidance related to changes in the domain name base on annual changes. Starting next year, we no longer intend to provide guidance on quarterly net additions. This change reflects our commitment to managing the business for long-term growth and stability, while aligning all of our guidance to be focused on key annual business and financial metrics.
The daily transparency into net additions to the domain name base, which is updated twice per day, will continue to be available on our website. As indicated in our earnings release today, we have entered into an agreement with NeuStar to sell the rights, economic benefits and obligations in all customer contracts related to our Security Services business. Transaction includes the sale of customer agreements related to our DDoS Protection, Managed DNS, DNS Firewall and Recursive DNS services. We will retain our proprietary technology, network assets, critical infrastructure, software and public DNS service to focus solely on supporting our core mission, which is ensuring the security, stability and resiliency of our core infrastructure.
As part of the transaction, we will continue to support the Security Services customers during the transition to NeuStar pursuant to a transition services agreement that is expected to be executed at closing. The transaction is subject to customary regulatory approval and is expected to close shortly following receipt of such approval.
We are committed to focusing on our core mission of providing critical Internet infrastructure, including Root Zone management, operation of 2 of the 13 global Internet root servers, operation of .gov and .edu and authoritative resolution for the .com and .net top-level domains, which support the majority of global e-commerce. For this reason, we're transitioning our Security Services customers to NeuStar.
To update you on our discussion about the Cooperative Agreement, we are mindful of the upcoming expiration and are progressing with the NTIA to amend the Cooperation Agreement by mutual agreement. When we are able to provide more information, we will do so. I will tell you that we are confident that an amended agreement can be executed before the expiration of the current term, which is the end of November. However, until that process is complete, there is nothing more that we can disclose at this time.
And now, I would like to turn the call over to George.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Jim, and good afternoon, everyone. Revenue for the third quarter totaled $306 million, up 4.6% year-over-year and up by 1.1% sequentially.Operating income for the period totaled $195 million compared with $181 million in the third quarter of 201
componenttext:
Thanks, Jim, and good afternoon, everyone. Revenue for the third quarter totaled $306 million, up 4.6% year-over-year and up by 1.1% sequentially.
Operating income for the period totaled $195 million compared with $181 million in the third quarter of 2017. The operating margin in the quarter came to 63.8% compared to 61.9% in the same quarter a year ago.
Net income totaled $138 million compared to $115 million a year earlier, which produced diluted earnings per share of $1.13 in the third quarter this year compared to $0.93 for the same quarter last year.
As of September 30, 2018, the company maintained total assets of $1.9 billion and total liabilities of $3.3 billion. Assets included $1.2 billion of cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities, of which $508 million were held domestically with the remainder held abroad.
I'll now review some additional third quarter financial metrics, which include non-GAAP operating margin, non-GAAP earnings per share, operating cash flow and free cash flow. I will then provide updates on our 2018 full year guidance.
As it relates to non-GAAP metrics, third quarter operating expense, which excludes $15 million of stock-based compensation, totaled $96 million, the same as last quarter and compared to $97 million in the third quarter a year ago.
Non-GAAP operating margin for the third quarter was 68.7% compared to 68.2% last quarter and 66.7% in the same quarter of 2017. Non-GAAP net income for the third quarter was $151 million, resulting in non-GAAP diluted earnings per share of $1.23, based on a weighted average diluted share count of 122.3 million shares. This compares to $1.18 last quarter and $1 in the third quarter of 2017.
Operating cash flow for the third quarter was $187 million and free cash flow was $177 million compared with $175 million and $153 million, respectively, for the third quarter last year.
Now I'd like to provide updates to our full year 2018 guidance. Revenue is now expected to be in the range of $1,211,000,000 to $1,216,000,000 increased and narrowed from the $1,205,000,000 to $1,215,000,000 range provided on our last call.
Non-GAAP operating margin is now expected to be between 67% and 67.5%, increased and narrowed from the 66% to 67% range provided on the last call. Our non-GAAP interest expense and non-GAAP nonoperating income net is now expected to be an expense of between $80 million to $84 million, decreased and narrowed from the $82 million to $89 million range provided on our last call.
Capital expenditures are now expected to be between $40 million and $50 million, decreased from the $45 million to $55 million range provided on our last call.
Cash taxes are still expected to be between $80 million and $90 million, unchanged from our last call.
In summary, the company continue to demonstrate sound financial performance during the third quarter. Now I'll turn the call back to Jim for his closing remarks.

componenttext: With regard to our Q3 expenses, as you can see [ out ] from a non-GAAP basis, our total expenses were about $96 million and we're relatively flat both year-over-year and sequentially. However, as you point out, we did see some movements between the categories sequentially. Now specifically, the sales and marketing, sequentially, we were down about $2.5 million quarter-to-quarter and that primarily was a result of lower direct marketing activities in the quarter. As you may recall, we increased our direct marketing activities late in 2017 with the intent to do more in 2018. However, as we pursue more direct marketing activities outside of the U.S., we found it took and it is taking frankly us longer to execute on those direct marketing activities abroad. So really, no change. Just I would say the normal ebb and flow of how marketing expenses get deployed into the marketplace.

And I just think we're -- we've executed some great campaigns in a variety of markets, but as I said, sometimes the international markets are taking a little bit longer to get that, that worked through. So I don't think anything is really different there. We continue to focus and make investments in marketing, and hopefully, that produces increases in domain name sales.

componenttext: I'll ask George to comment. I will just say that .com is an incredibly strong brand. You hear me say this all the time and I can't emphasize it enough quite frankly. It's a brand that gets a tremendous amount of exposure. It's the brand that gives you credibility worldwide for your online presence, and I think that has a great deal to do with the continued strength that. com is showing, but then George, if you would like to add some color, please feel free.

headline: VeriSign, Inc., Q3 2018 Earnings Call, Oct 25, 2018
